original_title: Profit-takings by local and foreign investors pep-up share market
original_body_lines: The stock market kicked off on a dull sentiment at the initial stages yesterday but by the middle part of the session it turned positive due to conclusion of profit takings by some local and foreign investors, market analysts said.

Amid those developments both indices moved upwards. All Share Price Index went up by 42.64 points while S and P SL20 index moved up by 10.72 points. Turnover stood at Rs 1.7 billion with three crossings. Those crossings were reported in Dialog where 12.5 million shares crossed; its shares traded at Rs 10.70, JKH 434,000 shares crossed for Rs 84.9 million and its shares price traded at Rs 195.75 and Hemas 500,000 shares crossed for Rs 39.5 million; its shares traded at Rs 79.

In the retail market top seven companies that mainly contributed to the turnover were; Pick Me Rs 203 million (5.1 million shares traded), Dipped Products Rs 178.8 million (4.6 million shares traded), Dialog Rs 91.5 million (8.6 million shares traded), Maskeliya Plantations Rs 45.9 million (858,000 shares traded), Commercial Bank Rs 44.8 million (414,000 shares shares traded), NTB Bank Rs 42,5 million (320,000 shares traded) and Commercial Credit Rs 40.6 million (1.1 million shares traded). During the day 91.9 million share volumes changed hands in 14000 transactions.

It is said that service sector counters, especially Dialog and PickMe, were the main contributors to the turnover, while manufacturing sector counters, especially JKH, Hemas and Dipped Products were the second largest contributors to the market. Banking and Financial Sector, especially Commercial NTB and Commercial Credit, were also active in yesterday’s market.
Yesterday the rupee opened slightly stronger at Rs 293.00/10 to the US dollar, from Rs 293.30/60 a day earlier, while bond yields were up, dealers said.

A bond maturing on 15.12.2027 was quoted at 11.25/35 percent, up from 11.20/30 percent. A bond maturing on 15.03.2028 was quoted at 11.55/65 percent, up from 11.50/65 percent. A bond maturing on 15.09.2029 was quoted at 11.80/12.00 percent, up from 11.75/90 percent.
